summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, directing the prosecution and defense to submit a joint estimate of when jury deliberations are likely to begin. The order is part of trial logistics planning, with jury selection scheduled to conclude by November 19, 2021, and opening statements set for November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the order regarding trial logistics and scheduling for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Jury Selection Completion
events.description: The date by which jury selection for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial is scheduled to be complete.

events.title: Opening Statements
events.description: The scheduled date for opening statements in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Deadline for Joint Trial Estimate
events.description: The deadline for the parties to submit a joint letter with their estimate of when jury deliberations will begin.

keyFacts: The court order is part of trial logistics planning for the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Jury selection is scheduled to be complete by November 19, 2021, with opening statements on November 29, 2021.
The court is assessing whether the trial may continue after the Christmas holiday, potentially requiring the jury to sit during the week between Christmas and New Year's Day.
The parties (prosecution and defense) are ordered to confer and submit a joint estimate of when jury deliberations will begin by October 12, 2021.
